plan.gerund: I plan going to the party.
plan.infinitive: I plan to go to the party.

practice.gerund: She practices playing the piano every day.

dislike.gerund: They dislike waiting in long lines.

decide.infinitive: We decided to take a trip to the mountains.

postpone.gerund: The meeting was postponed being held until next week.

learn.infinitive: She is learning to play the guitar.

come.infinitive: They came to see the new movie.

continue.gerund: She continued working despite the noise.
continue.infinitive: He continued to explain his point.

expect.infinitive: I expect to finish the project by Friday.

advise.gerund: She advised taking the earlier train.

would like.infinitive: I would like to visit Paris someday.

finish.gerund: They finished reading the book last night.

love.gerund: He loves swimming in the ocean.

can't stand.gerund: She can't stand waiting in traffic.
can't stand.infinitive: I can't stand to be late.

promise.infinitive: They promised to help us move.

begin.gerund: She began singing when she was a child.
begin.infinitive: He began to understand the problem.

start.gerund: They started working on the project early.
start.infinitive: I started to learn Spanish last year.

want.infinitive: She wants to become a doctor.

consider.gerund: He is considering moving to a new city.

need.infinitive: You need to finish your homework.

offer.infinitive: They offered to help with the preparations.

agree.infinitive: We agreed to meet at noon.

wish.infinitive: I wish to speak with the manager.
